column1: submits that he  has  proper instructions from the Second  appellant.
Grounds of appeal  on  behalf of both appellants are  identified as  follows:

column2: Evidence against the accused  persons were insufficient and contrary to the Law.
The  learned trial Judge had  not properly evaluated  the evidence.
Decision of the trial judge is  contrary to the evidence  before the court.
The  Ellenborough dictum is wrongly interpreted.
Identification parade notes were accepted wrongly. (sic)
There  is  no evidence against second  accused  appellant for aiding and  abetting
